author: M K
text:
The toll in the boiler blast at Oratukuppai near Chettipalayam climbed to six on Saturday as the last survivor , J. Saroj (23) of Alipurduar district of West Bengal, died at Coimbatore Medical College Hospital (CMCH) at 4.20 p.m.

All the victims from the same village in West Bengal suffered 100 per cent burns when they tried to open a boiler at Sri Nagalakshmi Pyrolysis Private Limited – around 11 a.m. on Thursday.

They were admitted to CMCH, where five others died between Friday afternoon and night.

Bodies of all the victims have been preserved at CMCH and a post-mortem will be conducted on the arrival of their relatives, which is likely to be on Sunday, officials said.

Representatives of the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) petitioned Collector Archana Patnaik urging the State government to give a compensation of Rs. 10 lakh each to families of the victims. They also held officials of various government departments responsible for the accident.

Meanwhile, residents of the village claimed that they have been petitioning the district administration at various levels against the illegal functioning of such units for over a year.

L. Sathyamoorthi (25), a villager, said many unauthorised hazardous industries were still operational in the locality, posing threat to residents and workers. The petitioners claimed that the Collector had promised to look into the issue and initiate appropriate action.

The CITU plans to stage a demonstration on Monday and petition the Superintendent of Police seeking cases to be registered against the accused under non-bailable sections.
title: Sixth victim of boiler blast dies
